snippet: President Obama’s approach to Syria is likely to create an important precedent in the often murky legal question of when presidents or nations may lawfully use military force.
abstract: Pres Obama's approach to military intervention in Syria will likely create important precedent for the often murky legal question of when presidents or nations may lawfully use force; proposed strike has number of unique qualities that set it apart from actions undertaken by previous presidents, including lack of self-defense rationale and fact that it would take place in sovereign nation without support from United Nations or NATO.
lead_paragraph: President Obama’s approach to Syria is likely to create an important precedent in the often murky legal question of when presidents or nations may lawfully use military force.

headline.main: Obama Tests Limits of Power in Syrian Conflict
headline.print_headline: President Tests Limits Of Power In Syrian Crisis
